description: Sum of iterates when phi, A000010, is iterated until fixed point 1.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: Sum[Nest[Phi, n, j], {j, 1, x[n]}], where x[n] = number of steps to reach fixed value.a(n) = n + a(phi(n)).a(n) = A092693(n) + n. - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Jul 02 2004
example: If phi is applied repeatedly to n = 91, the iterates {91,72,24,8,4,2,1} are obtained. Their sum is a(91)=91+72+24+8+4+2+1=202.
mathematica: f[n_] := Plus @@ Drop[ FixedPointList[ EulerPhi, n], -1]; Table[ f[n], {n, 66}] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Dec 16 2004 *)f[1] := 1; f[n_] := n + f[EulerPhi[n]]; Table[f[n], {n, 66}] (* _Carlos Eduardo Olivieri_, May 26 2015 *)
